eu.MrSnowflake.android.snowgestures
Class SnowGesture

java.lang.Object
  eu.MrSnowflake.android.snowgestures.SnowGesture

public class SnowGesture
extends java.lang.Object

A class which will make gesture recognition a lot easier!

Author:
MrSnowflake

Nested Class Summary
static interface SnowGesture.GestureCompleteListener
          The listener interface which is used to be called when a gesture is completed.
static interface SnowGesture.GestureListener
          The listener interface which is used to be called when a gesture got completed and got recognized as a gesture you supplied by registerGesture(String gesture, GestureListener listener).
 
Constructor Summary
SnowGesture()
          Default constructor, should be good for almost anyone.
SnowGesture(float minDist)
          Constructor which allows to manually set the minimal distance between 2 point to be counted as valid, to compensate for inaccuracies of the touch screen or input.

          To be deleted!!!!

Default constructor, should be good for almost anyone.

SnowGesture

public SnowGesture(float minDist)
Constructor which allows to manually set the minimal distance between 2 point to be counted as valid, to compensate for inaccuracies of the touch screen or input.

Parameters:
minDist - The minimal distance between 2 points to be counted as valid.
Method Detail

registerGestureCompleteListener

public void registerGestureCompleteListener(SnowGesture.GestureCompleteListener listener)
Register a GestureCompleteListener for when a gesture is completed.

Parameters:
listener - The GestureCompleteListener to be registered.

unregisterGestureCompleteListener

public void unregisterGestureCompleteListener(SnowGesture.GestureCompleteListener listener)
Unregisters a GestureCompleteListener.

Parameters:
listener - The GestureCompleteListener to be unregistered.

registerGesture

public boolean registerGesture(java.lang.String gesture,
                               SnowGesture.GestureListener listener)
Registers a gesture and GestureListener combination. The listener will get called when the supplied gesture has been completed. Note: Only 1 listener per gesture! If you try to register another listener to an already defined gesture, the previous listener will be unregistered.

Parameters:
gesture - The gesture which should invoke the listener.
listener - The GestureListener to be invoked.
Returns:

touchEvent

public void touchEvent(MotionEvent event)
This method will interpret the MotionEvents provided as parameter. You should invoke this method in your Activity.onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)

Parameters:
event - The event to interpret
